1 /**
  2  * @fileOverview contains TypeCheck class
  3  * 
  4  * if input of type in text see 
  5  * * https://developers.google.com/closure/compiler/docs/js-for-compiler
  6  * * use same format
  7  * * autogenerate function parameter check
  8  */
  9 
 10 /**
 11  * @namespace Strong typing for javascript
 12  */
 13 var TypeCheck	= {};
 14 
 15 // dependancy
 16 var QGetterSetter	= QGetterSetter	|| require('../src/qgettersetter.js')
 17 
 18 // export the namespace in node.js - if running in node.js
 19 if( typeof(window) === 'undefined' )	module.exports	= TypeCheck;
 20 
 21 
 22 
 23 /**
 24  * Check type with a object setter
 25  * 
 26  * @param  {Object} baseObject the base object which contains the property
 27  * @param  {String} property   the string of the property name
 28  * @param  {Array}  types      the allows tipe
 29  */
 30 TypeCheck.setter	= function(baseObject, property, types){
 31 	// check initial value
 32 	var value	= baseObject[property];
 33 	var isValid	= TypeCheck.value(value, types)
 34 	console.assert(isValid, 'initial value got invalid type');
 35 	// setup the setter
 36 	QGetterSetter.defineSetter|(baseObject, property, function(value){
 37 		// check the value type
 38 		var isValid	= TypeCheck.value(value, types);			
 39 		console.assert(isValid, 'invalid type');
 40 		// return the value
 41 		return value;
 42 	});
 43 };
 44 
 45 /**
 46  * function wrapper to check the type of function parameters and return value
 47  * @param  {Function} originalFn  the function to wrap
 48  * @param  {Array}    paramsTypes allowed types for the paramter. array with each item is the allowed types for this parameter.
 49  * @param  {Array}    returnTypes allowed types for the return value
 50  * @return {boolean}  return isValid, so true if types matche, false otherwise
 51  */
 52 TypeCheck.fn	= function(originalFn, paramsTypes, returnTypes){
 53 	return function(){
 54 		// check parameters type
 55 		console.assert(arguments.length <= paramsTypes.length, 'function received '+arguments.length+' parameters but recevied only '+returnTypes.length+'!');
 56 		for(var i = 0; i < paramsTypes.length; i++){
 57 			var isValid	= TypeCheck.value(arguments[i], paramsTypes[i]);			
 58 			console.assert(isValid, 'argument['+i+'] type is invalid. MUST be of type', paramsTypes[i], 'It is ===', arguments[i])
 59 		}
 60 		// forward the call to the original function
 61 		var result	= originalFn.apply(this, arguments);
 62 		// check the result type
 63 		var isValid	= TypeCheck.value(result, returnTypes);			
 64 		console.assert(isValid, 'invalid type for returned value. MUST be of type', returnTypes, 'It is ===', result);
 65 		// return the result
 66 		return result;
 67 	}
 68 }
 69 
 70 /**
 71  * Check the type of a value
 72  * @param  {*} value the value to check
 73  * @param  {Array.<function>} types the types allowed for this variable
 74  * @return {boolean} return isValid, so true if types matche, false otherwise
 75  */
 76 TypeCheck.value	= function(value, types){
 77 	// handle parameter polymorphism
 78 	if( types instanceof Array === false )	types	= [types];
 79 	// if types array is empty, default to ['always'], return true as in valid
 80 	if( types.length === 0 )	return true;
 81 	// go thru each type
 82 	var result	= false;
 83 	for(var i = 0; i < types.length; i++){
 84 		var type	= types[i];
 85 		if( type === Number ){
 86 			var valid	= typeof(value) === 'number';
 87 		}else if( type === String ){
 88 			var valid	= typeof(value) === 'string';
 89 		}else if( typeof(type) === 'string' && type.toLowerCase() === 'always' ){
 90 			var valid	= true;
 91 		}else if( typeof(type) === 'string' && type.toLowerCase() === 'never' ){
 92 			// return immediatly as a failed validator
 93 			return false;
 94 		}else if( typeof(type) === 'string' && type.toLowerCase() === 'nonan' ){
 95 			var valid	= value === value;
 96 			if( valid === false )	return false;
 97 			continue;	// continue as it is a validator
 98 		}else if( type instanceof TypeCheck._ValidatorClass ){
 99 			var valid	= type.fn(value);
100 			if( valid === false )	return false;
101 			continue;	// continue as it is a validator
102 		}else {
103 			var valid	= value instanceof type;
104 		}
105 		result	= result || valid;
106 	}
107 	// return the just computed result
108 	return result;
109 }
110 
111 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
112 //										//
113 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
114 
115 /**
116  * Validator creator. a Validator is a function which is used to validate .value().
117  * All the validators MUST be true for the checked value to be valid. 
118  * 
119  * @param {Function(value)} fn function which return true if value is valid, false otherwise
120  */
121 TypeCheck.Validator	= function(fn){
122 	return new TypeCheck._ValidatorClass(fn)
123 }
124 
125 /**
126  * Internal class to be recognisable by TypeCheck.value()
127  * 
128  * @param  {Function} fn function which return true if value is valid, false otherwise
129  */
130 TypeCheck._ValidatorClass= function(fn){
131 	console.assert(fn instanceof Function);
132 	this.fn	= fn;
133 }
134
